body:
It seems to me that `applicationinsights` package is not installed.

Please run:

```bash
pip install -r requirements.txt
```

Thanks for your response!

I executed the requirements.txt including all the Django dependencies that were not included in the txt and was able to start the server now. Yet, there's still this error after `python manage.py runserver` .
@NatashaSvic Could you please post a stacktrace of the new error?

> stacktrace MacBook-Pro:app user$ python manage.py runserver Performing system checks... System check identified no issues (0 silenced). May 13, 2019 - 11:44:02 Django version 2.0, using settings 'app.settings' Starting development server at http://127.0.0.1:8000/ Quit the server with CONTROL-C. Unhandled exception in thread started by .wrapper at 0x10baa0048> Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/core/servers/basehttp.py", line 44, in get_internal_wsgi_application return import_string(app_path) File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/utils/module_loading.py", line 17, in import_string module = import_module(module_path) File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/importlib/__init__.py", line 127, in import_module return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level) File "", line 1006, in _gcd_import File "", line 983, in _find_and_load File "", line 967, in _find_and_load_unlocked File "", line 677, in _load_unlocked File "", line 728, in exec_module File "", line 219, in _call_with_frames_removed File "/Users/user/doccano/app/app/wsgi.py", line 16, in application = get_wsgi_application() File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/core/wsgi.py", line 13, in get_wsgi_application return WSGIHandler() File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/core/handlers/wsgi.py", line 140, in __init__ self.load_middleware() File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/core/handlers/base.py", line 37, in load_middleware middleware = import_string(middleware_path) File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/utils/module_loading.py", line 17, in import_string module = import_module(module_path) File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/importlib/__init__.py", line 127, in import_module return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level) File "", line 1006, in _gcd_import File "", line 983, in _find_and_load File "", line 953, in _find_and_load_unlocked File "", line 219, in _call_with_frames_removed File "", line 1006, in _gcd_import File "", line 983, in _find_and_load File "", line 965, in _find_and_load_unlocked ModuleNotFoundError: No module named 'applicationinsights' The above exception was the direct cause of the following exception: Traceback (most recent call last): File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/utils/autoreload.py", line 225, in wrapper fn(*args, **kwargs) File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/core/management/commands/runserver.py", line 140, in inner_run handler = self.get_handler(*args, **options) File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/contrib/staticfiles/management/commands/runserver.py", line 27, in get_handler handler = super().get_handler(*args, **options) File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/core/management/commands/runserver.py", line 65, in get_handler return get_internal_wsgi_application() File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/site-packages/django/core/servers/basehttp.py", line 49, in get_internal_wsgi_application ) from err django.core.exceptions.ImproperlyConfigured: WSGI application 'app.wsgi.application' could not be loaded; Error importing module.
Looks like `applicationinsights` can't be found for some reason although it's declared in `requirements.txt`. Could you post the result of `pip freeze`?

All the dependencies except for applicationinsights are there. What's the output of `pip install applicationinsights==0.11.7`?

> All the dependencies except for applicationinsights are there. What's the output of `pip install applicationinsights==0.11.7`?
Thanks a lot for your help, much appreciated! 

Installed the new dependency and now it runs into encoding issues:

  File "/Users/user/anaconda3/lib/python3.7/locale.py", line 495, in _parse_localename
    raise ValueError('unknown locale: %s' % localename)
ValueError: unknown locale: UTF-8

Overall, the `requirements.txt` missed a lot of dependencies in my case. For example, I had to debug all the way through Django since it was not listed in the requirements. When I run the doccano server directly from the docker image in a VM, it works. On my native machine, it works only when I delete the image and then re-initiate it. Running the server once it's been stared and then stopped, does not work. 

`docker rm <container>`
`docker container ls`
`docker run -d --name doccano -p 8000:80 chakkiworks/doccano`

then it works, but I lose all my projects and need to create user profiles from scratch.

There must be something strange with the host system so perhaps moving to Docker is the best option.

To remove the need for the `docker rm`, you can start the container like this `docker run --rm ...` so that it will be automatically removed on exit.

In order to preserve the database across restarts, you can try this `docker run -v /path/to/some/folder/db.sqlite3:/doccano/app/db.sqlite3 ...` so that the database file will be stored outside of the container.

> There must be something strange with the host system so perhaps moving to Docker is the best option.
> 
> To remove the need for the `docker rm`, you can start the container like this `docker run --rm ...` so that it will be automatically removed on exit.
> 
> In order to preserve the database across restarts, you can try this `docker run -v /path/to/some/folder/db.sqlite3:/doccano/app/db.sqlite3 ...` so that the database file will be stored outside of the container.

`docker start doccano` did the job eventually. The Django app still doesn't work for me but I'll stick to this now. Thank you very much for helping @c-w
There's also the new option to start the stack with `docker-compose up`. Could you give that a try and let me know if it works for you?

ERROR:
        Can't find a suitable configuration file in this directory or any
        parent. Are you in the right directory?

        Supported filenames: docker-compose.yml, docker-compose.yaml @

> There's also the new option to start the stack with `docker-compose up`. Could you give that a try and let me know if it works for you?
Please update to the latest version of the code and ensure that the file [docker-compose.yml](https://github.com/chakki-works/doccano/blob/master/docker-compose.yml) exists in the project directory.
Please raise a new issue if you still face this phenomenon.
